decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

ART/2024/CU94TR/EE (Existing Elevations); ART/2024/CU94TR/EL (Existing Floor Layouts); ART/2024/CU94TR/FP (Fire Safety Plans); ART/2024/CU94TR/PE (Proposed Elevations); ART/2024/CU94TR/PL (Proposed Floor Layouts); ART/2024/CU94TR/SPLP (Site Plan & Location Plan); Design & Access Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse on site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to occupation of the proposed flats, the separate private amenity space areas for Flats A and B, as shown on Plan ref: ART/2024/CU94TR/SPLP, shall be laid out accordingly with appropriate boundary treatments to delineate the spaces. The amenity areas shown on the approved plans shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development. The retained outbuilding shall be for the sole use of the occupants of Flat B and shall not be used for any habitable purpose. The use of the outbuilding shall remain as an incidental use for the occupants of Flat B and for bicycle storage, and at no time, shall a kitchen or cooking facility be installed.
Reason: To ensure that both of the proposed flats have access to private amenity spaces and to control the use of the retained outbuilding.
| No part of the flat roofs of the proposed dwellinghouse shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom below kitchen/dining/living room of separate flat and by at least 10dB for bedrooms adjoining/above the communal main entrance. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan. | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan. | The bicycle storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse and recycling storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers.
description: Conversion of single dwelling into 2 Self-Contained flats; Roof extension to rear (main) roof slope; part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope. Single storey rear and front porch extension
